## R Markdown
## Explore Sandborn Lewis Data, clean col names, convert to lowercase
```{r read in sandborn_lewis_data, eval= FALSE }
sandborn_lewis_data <- read_excel("1 Sandborn Lewis data.xlsx") %>%  
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  rename_with(tolower) %>%
  mutate(bulk_density = as.numeric(bulk_density),
         depth1 = as.numeric(depth1),
         depth2 = as.numeric(depth2),
         cconc = as.numeric(cconc),
         total_depth=depth2-depth1)
glimpse(sandborn_lewis_data)
```

## Retain Tidy Excel Columns A-F,J-L, Q, S; create new dataframe sandborn_lewis_select_variables

```{r new dataframe with select variables, eval = FALSE}
sandborn_lewis_data <- select(sandborn_lewis_data, source, id, order, lat, lon, latlon_q, horizon, depth1, depth2, total_depth, bulk_density, cconc)
glimpse(sandborn_lewis_data)
``` 

```{r Create new column containing gap filled bulk desnity values}
bulk_density_gapfilled <- sandborn_lewis_data %>%
  select(bulk_density) %>%
  slice(1:3, 8:10, 16:28, 34:39, 46:146) %>%
  filter(!is.na(bulk_density)) %>% 
  distinct() %>% 
  pull() 
```

```{r}
glimpse(bulk_density_gapfilled)
```
